title: Here's when the Oppo Find X8 Ultra and Find N5 are coming
description: Oppo is launching the Find X8 and Find X8 Pro later this month, but the Find X8 Ultra won't be joining them. So if you've been wondering when to expect the Find X8 Ultra to become official, a new rumor gives us a rough time frame, and it's the first quarter of next year. That means Oppo's absolute flagship device will arrive between January and March. During the same period, Oppo is also said to unveil the Find N5 foldable, the successor to the Find N3 from 2023 (the "4" is apparently being skipped due to tetraphobia). Oppo Find N3 If history repeats itself, then the Find N5 will...
excerpt: The Find N5 is likely going to be rebranded as OnePlus Open 2 for global markets. Oppo is launching the Find X8 and Find X8 Pro later this month, but the...
text: Oppo is launching the Find X8 and Find X8 Pro later this month, but the Find X8 Ultra won't be joining them. So if you've been wondering when to expect the Find X8 Ultra to become official, a new rumor gives us a rough time frame, and it's the first quarter of next year. That means Oppo's absolute flagship device will arrive between January and March. During the same period, Oppo is also said to unveil the Find N5 foldable, the successor to the Find N3 from 2023 (the "4" is apparently being skipped due to tetraphobia). Oppo Find N3If history repeats itself, then the Find N5 will be released in international markets as the OnePlus Open 2, and that phone may very well arrive in Q1 2025 as well. Interestingly, the source of today's rumor says Oppo is testing the Find N5 with the same camera setup as the Find X8 Ultra, but is likely to ditch it and continue with a tri-cam setup. This tells us that the Find X8 Ultra will unsurprisingly rock four cameras on the rear. But it's also disappointing to hear that the Find N5's camera game won't be on par. Then again, all foldables are at least a bit behind their slab-style counterparts in that regard, so this wouldn't be anything new. Source
html:
Oppo is launching the Find X8 and Find X8 Pro later this month, but the Find X8 Ultra won't be joining them. So if you've been wondering when to expect the Find X8 Ultra to become official, a new rumor gives us a rough time frame, and it's the first quarter of next year.

That means Oppo's absolute flagship device will arrive between January and March. During the same period, Oppo is also said to unveil the Find N5 foldable, the successor to the Find N3 from 2023 (the "4" is apparently being skipped due to tetraphobia).

Oppo Find N3

If history repeats itself, then the Find N5 will be released in international markets as the OnePlus Open 2, and that phone may very well arrive in Q1 2025 as well.

Interestingly, the source of today's rumor says Oppo is testing the Find N5 with the same camera setup as the Find X8 Ultra, but is likely to ditch it and continue with a tri-cam setup. This tells us that the Find X8 Ultra will unsurprisingly rock four cameras on the rear.

But it's also disappointing to hear that the Find N5's camera game won't be on par. Then again, all foldables are at least a bit behind their slab-style counterparts in that regard, so this wouldn't be anything new.

Source
